sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxy function is used to determine the maximum value of y for the current graphics mode.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxy** function is used to** **determine the maximum value of y for the current graphics mode.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        Â…
        put "The maximum y value is ", maxy
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the maximum y value.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the maximum y value.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode. See setscreen for details.

For the default IBM PC compatible graphics mode (CGA), maxy = 199.
sections.mdown_content:
The screen should be in a "*graphics*" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "*graphics*" mode. See **setscreen **for details.
For the default IBM PC compatible graphics mode (CGA), **maxy **= 199.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported unqualified.

This means that you can call the function by calling maxy or by calling View.maxy.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported unqualified.
This means that you can call the function by calling **maxy** or by calling **View.maxy**.

sections.title: See also
sections.raw_content: Draw.Dot for an example of the use of maxy and for a diagram illustrating x and y positions.
sections.mdown_content: **[draw_dot.html](Draw.Dot)** for an example of the use of **[maxy.html](maxy)** and for a diagram illustrating x and y positions.
